sources.title: Tom Sawyer (1973)
sources.description: The 1973 musical film "Tom Sawyer" follows the adventures of Tom Sawyer and his friend Huckleberry Finn as they navigate childhood mischief in their small Mississippi town. The story includes their attempts to resurrect a dead cat, witness a murder, and ultimately, Tom's courageous testimony to save an innocent man, all while dealing with the complexities of young love and friendship. The film was produced by Reader's Digest in collaboration with Arthur P. Jacobs, and its screenplay and songs were written by the Sherman Brothers, Robert B. Sherman and Richard M. Sherman.

metadata.Plot: A musical version of one of America's most beloved stories. Tom Sawyer and Huckleberry Finn investigate a suspicious graveyard murder and find themselves in hot water with the sinister Indian Joe in this adaptation of Mark Twain's classic novel.
metadata.Writer: Mark Twain, Robert B. Sherman, Richard M. Sherman
metadata.Actors: Johnny Whitaker, Celeste Holm, Warren Oates
